snippet: I spent seven and a half years at Guantánamo, without explanation.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Lakhdar Boumediene, the lead plaintiff in Boumediene v Bush, who was in military custody at the Guantanamo Bay Naval Base prison facility from 2002 to 2009, describes how he came to be imprisoned and his experiences at the prison; asserts that as long as Guantanamo stays open and innocent men remain there, his thoughts will be with those left behind in a place of suffering and injustice.
lead_paragraph: I spent seven and a half years at Guantánamo, without explanation.
